hints.content:
Every bill has a different value.

Dollar name | Picture | Value
- | - | -
One dollar bill | ![Front and back photo of one dollar bill.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/526e9b19f2c39d0d908b6c531d510186f6e93e97.png) | $\$1$
Five dollar bill | ![Front and back photo of five dollar bill.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/5069901d0226c2c5f1c3e73b2b5d7e48ee1e1eee.png) | $\$5$
Ten dollar bill | ![Front and back photo of ten dollar bill.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/35b0286a92e1825d39af39b5e362e5d9674eb00d.png) | $\$10$
Twenty dollar bill | ![Front and back photo of twenty dollar bill.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/66f0febd8ba41a0e3413f72b2f1fc2d54a3819de.png) | $\$20$

Let's label the value of each set of bills and find the total.

![1, five dollar bill. 2, one dollar bills.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/3ff39152701d0ad5a1fbdc3ec128b4cd71555630.png)

$\begin{align}
&\underbrace{\$\purpleD{5}}_{\purpleD{1}{\text{ five dollar bill}}}   +\underbrace{\$\blueE{1} + \$\blueE{1}}_{\blueE{2}{\text{ one dollar bills}}}\\\\
&\underbrace{\$\purpleD{5}}_{\purpleD{1}{\text{ five dollar bill}}}   +\underbrace{\$\blueE{2}}_{\blueE{2}{\text{ one dollar bills}}}=\$7
\end{align}$

This set of bills has a value of $\$7$, so it is **not** equal to $\$52$.

![4, ten dollar bills. 2, one dollar bills.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/4a0d7de14ae91dc2c3d498ef1664d90a8db74350.png)

$\begin{align}
&\underbrace{\$\goldE{10} + \$\goldE{10} + \$\goldE{10} + \$\goldE{10}}_{\goldE{4}{\text{ ten dollar bills}}}   +\underbrace{\$\blueE{1} + \$\blueE{1}}_{\blueE{2}{\text{ one dollar bills}}}\\\\
&\underbrace{\$\goldE{40}}_{\goldE{4}{\text{ ten dollar bills}}}   +\underbrace{\$\blueE{2}}_{\blueE{2}{\text{ one dollar bills}}}=\$42
\end{align}$

This set of bills has a value of $\$42$, so it is **not** equal to $\$52$.

![2, twenty dollar bills. 1, ten dollar bill. 2, one dollar bills.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/8f5e31cdec28f80c40d2df8f1401a793b13069b7.png)

$\begin{align}
&\underbrace{\$\maroonD{20} + \$\maroonD{20}}_{\maroonD{2}{\text{ twenty dollar bills}}}   + \underbrace{\$\goldE{10}}_{\goldE{1}{\text{ ten dollar bill}}} +\underbrace{\$\blueE{1} + \$\blueE{1}}_{\blueE{2}{\text{ one dollar bills}}}\\\\
&\underbrace{\$\maroonD{40}}_{\maroonD{2}{\text{ twenty dollar bills}}} 
 + \underbrace{\$\goldE{10}}_{\goldE{1}{\text{ ten dollar bill}}}   +\underbrace{\$\blueE{2}}_{\blueE{2}{\text{ one dollar bills}}}=\$52
\end{align}$

This set of bills has a value of $\$52$, so it **is** equal to Tom's amount of money.

Tom could have this set of bills:

![2, twenty dollar bills. 1, ten dollar bill. 2, one dollar bills.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/8f5e31cdec28f80c40d2df8f1401a793b13069b7.png)

question.content:
Tom has $\$52$.

**Which set of bills could Tom have?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

choices.content: ![2, twenty dollar bills. 1, ten dollar bill. 2, one dollar bills.](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/8f5e31cdec28f80c40d2df8f1401a793b13069b7.png)
